subject: RE: [junit] printing my own debug messages
msgSnippet: Why not use another great piece of freeware, log4j?   This can be downloaded from the Apache site. rgds, APC ... From: steinbeck@ice.mpg.de
messageBody:
Why not use another great piece of freeware, log4j? This can be downloaded
from the Apache site.

rgds, APC

-----Original Message-----
From: steinbeck@... [mailto:steinbeck@...]
Sent: 03 July 2001 14:01
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] printing my own debug messages


Hi there,

I've check all the available documentation on whether there is a
possibility to print my own debug output messages from a test case in
a controlled way - ideally I would like to get them in a
"results.txt" like can be produced by the junit task in ant. It seems
that this is not the way that I'm supposed to go, since there seems to
be no option for that.

Nevertheless, it would be nice to use the test case for debugging
(until it works).
It there an option for that?

Cheers,

Chris
